result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard BJ Green

records.addlTxt: completion of SPD representation

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard BJ Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Richard BJ Green. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Deft. to plea in 21CF1675 to Ct. 1 w/o repeater enhancer but with 2nd and subsequent enhancer, remainder to be dri as well as 22CF264.  State recommends I/S 2 yrs. IC, 2 yrs. ES, 3 yrs. probation, defense fta.

PLEA: Ct. 1: NC
BTC: Ct. 1: GUILTY.  Ct. 2 & 22CF264: DRI.
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC: Ct. 1: I/S 4 yrs., 2 yrs. IC, 2 yrs. ES, 3 yrs. probation.

Conditions:
60 days RCJ with Huber for employment, CFTS.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Mental health assessment.
Maintain full time employment.
Pay costs of supervision, court costs, surcharges
Do not associate with any drug users or dealers.
DNA sample.

FAW/VOTE.

Eligible for CIP & SAP.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ALSO $800.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No drug paraphernalia. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard BJ Green in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Richard BJ Green. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
BTC: Bench warrant vacated.  Signature bond will not be forfeited, however, bond will be amended to cash.
Defendant has tested today with RCAP with positive results for cocaine.
Defense is requesting to set for COP/sentencing and needs treatment and can benefit with services through probation.  Defendant states he will be contesting today's results.  Will be coming in twice weekly for testing.
BTC: Bond is amended to $200 cash, $800 signature on each case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

**DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.**
Return on warrant on June 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return on warrant on June 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard BJ Green not in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Richard BJ Green. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant does not appear.  Defense is uncertain on why he does not appear on this date.
Court has received an RCAP report that defendant has failed to appear since January for testing.
BTC: Bench warrant/bond forfeiture authorized.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
NG plea entered.

9:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard BJ Green in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Richard BJ Green. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
